title: Balfour Beatty issues fresh profit warning, faces likely loss
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 9, 2015, 09:14 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 16 mins Balfour Beatty issues fresh profit warning, faces likely loss Reuters – 18 minutes ago View Photo 
Raindrops are seen on a sign at a Balfour Beatty construction site in central London September 29, 2014. … 
LONDON (Reuters) - British infrastructure group Balfour Beatty (BALF.L) issued a fresh profit warning on Thursday, saying it had found further problems in its business which are likely to tip it into another loss for 2015. 
Under new CEO Leo Quinn, the company said on Thursday it had found legacy issues in the UK, the U.S. and the Middle East which would cut 2015 pre-tax earnings by 120 million pounds to 150 million pounds. 
The UK accounts for around two-thirds of that amount. 
According to Reuters data, analysts had expected 2015 pre-tax profit of 77 million pounds before this warning. 
Balfour has been hammered by the discovery of problematic construction contracts that has destroyed its profitability. It scrapped its dividend in March after suffering a 2014 loss and warned of difficult times ahead. 
Balfour is counting the cost of the wafer-thin margins it agreed to in its hunt for business during the recession. It has previously issued five profit warnings within two years and cancelled a 200 million pound share buyback. 
"The issues we are working through are as I set out in March and legacy challenges remain," Quinn said. "However, we are making encouraging progress on the group's transformation." 
Balfour also said it was making good progress against its cost cutting programme and as a result its net cash was set to exceed 200 million pounds at the half year end in June, substantially better than last year. 
(Reporting by Kate Holton; editing by Paul Sandle and Keith Weir)
